Title: Dell Latitude D620 CD Drive Replacement

Lines.Text: power down the laptop and remove the battery .
open the laptop cover all of the way .

Steps.Text_raw: Power down the laptop and remove the battery. Open the laptop cover all of the way.

Lines.Text: locate the notch under the cover at the top of the keyboard
using the spudger as a lever , lift the plastic covering
carefully remove the rest of the covering from right to left

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the notch under the cover at the top of the keyboard Using the spudger as a lever, lift the plastic covering Carefully remove the rest of the covering from right to left

Lines.Text: unscrew the top portion of the keyboard using a 00 screwdriver

Steps.Text_raw: Unscrew the top portion of the keyboard using a #00 screwdriver

Lines.Text: hold keyboard from the top and gently pull towards the lcd screen to remove the keyboard from the case
don't pull on the keyboard too forcefully because it is attached to the motherboard with a short , thin ribbon cable

Steps.Text_raw: Hold keyboard from the top and gently pull towards the LCD screen to remove the keyboard from the case Don't pull on the keyboard too forcefully because it is attached to the motherboard with a short, thin ribbon cable

Lines.Text: once keyboard is out of the case , lay it face-down on the track pad

Steps.Text_raw: Once keyboard is out of the case, lay it face-down on the track pad

Lines.Text: using a small spudger , pull back on the black bar to release the blue lever

Steps.Text_raw: Using a small spudger, pull back on the black bar to release the blue lever

Lines.Text: pull up on the metal bar connected to the socket to detach the ribbon cable

Steps.Text_raw: Pull up on the metal bar connected to the socket to detach the ribbon cable

Lines.Text: press in the tab on the bottom right side of the cd drive
the tab comes out on its own ; there is no need to pull it out manually .

Steps.Text_raw: Press in the tab on the bottom right side of the CD drive The tab comes out on its own; there is no need to pull it out manually.

Lines.Text: gently pull the tab to remove the disk tray .

Steps.Text_raw: Gently pull the tab to remove the disk tray.

Subject: CD Drive

Title: Sony Vaio VGN-S260 Upper Casing Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the laptop over so the vaio logo is facing down
locate the battery at the top and find the release and unlock slides on the battery
slide the unlock tab to the unlock position
slide the release tab in the direction of the arrow , i . e . towards the unlock tab

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the laptop over so the Vaio logo is facing down Locate the battery at the top and Find the release and unlock slides on the battery Slide the unlock tab to the unlock position Slide the release tab in the direction of the arrow, i.e. towards the unlock tab

Lines.Text: with the tabs still in the unlock position , slide the battery away from the main case .

Steps.Text_raw: With the tabs still in the unlock position, slide the battery away from the main case.

Lines.Text: flip the computer over so the vaio logo is facedown
unscrew the 2 screws next to the battery

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the computer over so the Vaio logo is facedown Unscrew the 2 screws next to the battery

Lines.Text: flip the computer over again so the vaio logo is face up
open the lid

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the computer over again so the Vaio logo is face up Open the lid

Lines.Text: press down on the outer gray shell around the keyboard
use the spudger to gently lift keyboard
do not pull up the keyboard too far as it is attached to a ribbon underneath

Steps.Text_raw: Press down on the outer gray shell around the keyboard Use the spudger to gently lift keyboard Do not pull up the keyboard too far as it is attached to a ribbon underneath

Lines.Text: lift up lever underneath the ribbon to detach the keyboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up lever underneath the ribbon to detach the keyboard.

Lines.Text: remove memory/wireless compartment cover

Steps.Text_raw: Remove memory/wireless compartment cover

Lines.Text: flip so the vaio logo is face down
locate and remove a total of 8 screws on the bottom .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip so the Vaio Logo is face down Locate and remove a total of 8 screws on the bottom.

Lines.Text: find and remove 5 screws ( they all have arrows next to them ) from cover

Steps.Text_raw: Find and remove 5 screws (they all have arrows next to them) from cover

Lines.Text: flip the laptop over so the vaio logo is face up
use the spudger to pop up the upper casing
do not lift too much as the uppercasing is attached to wires underneath
remove the wires that are attaching the uppercasing to the motherboard

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the laptop over so the Vaio logo is face up Use the spudger to pop up the upper casing Do not lift too much as the Uppercasing is attached to wires underneath Remove the wires that are attaching the uppercasing to the motherboard

Lines.Text: remove the uppercasing

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the uppercasing

Subject: Upper Casing

Lines.Text: flip the laptop over so the vaio logo is facing down
locate the battery at the top and find the release and unlock slides on the battery
slide the unlock tab to the unlock position
slide the release tab in the direction of the arrow , i . e . towards the unlock tab

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the laptop over so the Vaio logo is facing down Locate the battery at the top and Find the release and unlock slides on the battery Slide the unlock tab to the unlock position Slide the release tab in the direction of the arrow, i.e. towards the unlock tab

Lines.Text: with the tabs still in the unlock position , slide the battery away from the main case .

Steps.Text_raw: With the tabs still in the unlock position, slide the battery away from the main case.

Lines.Text: flip the computer over so the vaio logo is facedown
unscrew the 2 screws next to the battery

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the computer over so the Vaio logo is facedown Unscrew the 2 screws next to the battery

Lines.Text: flip the computer over again so the vaio logo is face up
open the lid

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the computer over again so the Vaio logo is face up Open the lid

Lines.Text: press down on the outer gray shell around the keyboard
use the spudger to gently lift keyboard
do not pull up the keyboard too far as it is attached to a ribbon underneath

Steps.Text_raw: Press down on the outer gray shell around the keyboard Use the spudger to gently lift keyboard Do not pull up the keyboard too far as it is attached to a ribbon underneath

Lines.Text: lift up lever underneath the ribbon to detach the keyboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up lever underneath the ribbon to detach the keyboard.

Title: Sony Vaio VGN-S260 Logic Board Replacement

Lines.Text: flip the laptop over so the vaio logo is facing down
locate the battery at the top and find the release and unlock slides on the battery
slide the unlock tab to the unlock position
slide the release tab in the direction of the arrow , i . e . towards the unlock tab

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the laptop over so the Vaio logo is facing down Locate the battery at the top and Find the release and unlock slides on the battery Slide the unlock tab to the unlock position Slide the release tab in the direction of the arrow, i.e. towards the unlock tab

Lines.Text: with the tabs still in the unlock position , slide the battery away from the main case .

Steps.Text_raw: With the tabs still in the unlock position, slide the battery away from the main case.

Lines.Text: flip the computer over so the vaio logo is facedown
unscrew the 2 screws next to the battery

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the computer over so the Vaio logo is facedown Unscrew the 2 screws next to the battery

Lines.Text: flip the computer over again so the vaio logo is face up
open the lid

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the computer over again so the Vaio logo is face up Open the lid

Lines.Text: press down on the outer gray shell around the keyboard
use the spudger to gently lift keyboard
do not pull up the keyboard too far as it is attached to a ribbon underneath

Steps.Text_raw: Press down on the outer gray shell around the keyboard Use the spudger to gently lift keyboard Do not pull up the keyboard too far as it is attached to a ribbon underneath

Lines.Text: lift up lever underneath the ribbon to detach the keyboard .

Steps.Text_raw: Lift up lever underneath the ribbon to detach the keyboard.

Lines.Text: remove memory/wireless compartment cover

Steps.Text_raw: Remove memory/wireless compartment cover

Lines.Text: flip so the vaio logo is face down
locate and remove a total of 8 screws on the bottom .

Steps.Text_raw: Flip so the Vaio Logo is face down Locate and remove a total of 8 screws on the bottom.

Lines.Text: find and remove 5 screws ( they all have arrows next to them ) from cover

Steps.Text_raw: Find and remove 5 screws (they all have arrows next to them) from cover

Lines.Text: flip the laptop over so the vaio logo is face up
use the spudger to pop up the upper casing
do not lift too much as the uppercasing is attached to wires underneath
remove the wires that are attaching the uppercasing to the motherboard

Steps.Text_raw: Flip the laptop over so the Vaio logo is face up Use the spudger to pop up the upper casing Do not lift too much as the Uppercasing is attached to wires underneath Remove the wires that are attaching the uppercasing to the motherboard

Lines.Text: remove the uppercasing

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the uppercasing

Lines.Text: locate the yellow power adapter
follow its wire to white logic board connector
pull out the wire from white logic board connector

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the yellow power adapter Follow its wire to white logic board connector Pull out the wire from white logic board connector

Lines.Text: locate the screws on the fan filter casing
remove these screws

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the screws on the fan filter casing Remove these screws

Lines.Text: remove the screw next to the yellow power adapter
lift out power adapter and fan filter

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the screw next to the yellow power adapter Lift out power adapter and fan filter

Lines.Text: locate the screw holding the optical drive casing to the logic board
remove this screw

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the screw holding the optical drive casing to the logic board Remove this screw

Lines.Text: locate ribbon connecting optical drive case to logic board .
pop off the ribbon
remove the metal pc-card cage

Steps.Text_raw: Locate ribbon connecting optical drive case to logic board. Pop off the ribbon Remove the metal PC-Card cage

Lines.Text: locate the four screws holding the optical drive to the logic board
remove the screws

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the four screws holding the optical drive to the logic board Remove the screws

Lines.Text: locate brown locking tab above optical drive .
lift up on brown locking tab until ribbon is loose
gently slide out and remove the optical drive from the computer

Steps.Text_raw: Locate brown locking tab above optical drive. Lift up on brown locking tab until ribbon is loose Gently slide out and remove the optical drive from the computer

Lines.Text: remove the blue ribbon from the ethernet circuit board

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the blue ribbon from the Ethernet Circuit Board

Lines.Text: locate the screws near the ethernet port circuit board
remove the screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the screws near the Ethernet Port circuit board Remove the screws.

Lines.Text: locate the screws for the second ethernet circuit board
remove the screws

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the screws for the second ethernet circuit board Remove the screws

Lines.Text: remove the ethernet ports

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the ethernet ports

Lines.Text: locate the screws holding the hard drive casing in place .
remove the screws

Steps.Text_raw: Locate the screws holding the hard drive casing in place. Remove the screws

Lines.Text: find orange ribbon that is connected to the hard drive .
find the holder of the ribbon and pop the ribbon off from it

Steps.Text_raw: Find orange ribbon that is connected to the hard drive. Find the holder of the ribbon and pop the ribbon off from it

Lines.Text: remove the casing and the orange ribbon

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the casing and the orange ribbon

Lines.Text: locate screws on the logic board
remove the screws

Steps.Text_raw: Locate screws on the logic board Remove the screws

Lines.Text: locate nut on logic board
take out the nut using the 5 mm nut driver
using a magnetic screwdriver handle will also work as well

Steps.Text_raw: Locate nut on logic board Take out the nut using the 5mm nut driver Using a magnetic screwdriver handle will also work as well

Lines.Text: remove the lcd display ribbon
it is helpful to use the spudger here
this is difficult to remove

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the LCD display ribbon It is helpful to use the spudger here This is difficult to remove

Lines.Text: gently lift the logic board from the laptop .
the logic board will be attached to the network wireless chip , which is also attached to the base of the laptop
remove the chip by poping the tabs on the side
slide out the network card
you are now free to take the logic board away from the base

Steps.Text_raw: Gently lift the logic board from the laptop. The logic board will be attached to the network wireless chip, which is also attached to the base of the laptop Remove the chip by poping the tabs on the side Slide out the network card You are now free to take the logic board away from the base

Subject: Logic Board

Lines.Text: move the latch to the right of the battery to unlock .

Steps.Text_raw: Move the latch to the right of the battery to unlock.

Lines.Text: slide the latch on the left directly below the battery to unlock and pull out the battery as shown .
the latch must be held in position to remove the battery .

Steps.Text_raw: Slide the latch on the left directly below the battery to unlock and pull out the battery as shown. The latch must be held in position to remove the battery.

Lines.Text: remove the hinge covers by lifting each with the sharp point of the spudger .
notice that the middle cover has a different shape and is more difficult to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the hinge covers by lifting each with the sharp point of the spudger. Notice that the middle cover has a different shape and is more difficult to remove.

Lines.Text: remove the six screw covers on the front bezel with the sharp point of the spudger .
the bottom two are more difficult to remove .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the six screw covers on the front bezel with the sharp point of the spudger. The bottom two are more difficult to remove.

Lines.Text: remove the six 5.9 mm phillips screws securing the screen bezel .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the six 5.9 mm Philips screws securing the screen bezel.

Lines.Text: remove the front bezel by prying it off with the wedged end of the spudger .
verify that your spudger does not touch the lcd .
the screen inverter is now exposed below the lcd .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the front bezel by prying it off with the wedged end of the spudger. Verify that your spudger does not touch the LCD. The screen inverter is now exposed below the LCD.

Lines.Text: remove the single 3.8 mm phillips screw mounting the screen inverter to the computer .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the single 3.8mm Phillips screw mounting the screen inverter to the computer.

Lines.Text: use your finger , or the spudger , to pry the inverter board out .
this exposes the wires behind it .

Steps.Text_raw: Use your finger, or the spudger, to pry the inverter board out. This exposes the wires behind it.

Lines.Text: unplug the lcd back light cables from the right side of the screen inverter .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the LCD back light cables from the right side of the screen inverter.

Lines.Text: remove the six screws that mount the screen to the hinge mounts .
two 2.5 mm phillips screws .
four 3.8 mm phillips screws .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the six screws that mount the screen to the hinge mounts. Two 2.5 mm Phillips screws. Four 3.8 mm Phillips screws.

Lines.Text: unplug the cable from the webcam board .
be gentle , do not use excessive force or you may break the connection .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the cable from the webcam board. Be gentle, do not use excessive force or you may break the connection.

Lines.Text: separate the screen from the display cover .
do not touch the back of the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: Separate the screen from the display cover. Do not touch the back of the screen.

Lines.Text: remove the three tape strips that hold down the cables .
be careful not to tear any of the tape . the piece holding down the webcam wires is especially delicate .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the three tape strips that hold down the cables. Be careful not to tear any of the tape. The piece holding down the webcam wires is especially delicate.

Lines.Text: unplug the display data cable from the screen connector .
this connection is very fragile ; do not use excessive force .
the screen should now be free from all wire connections .

Steps.Text_raw: Unplug the display data cable from the screen connector. This connection is very fragile; do not use excessive force. The screen should now be free from all wire connections.

Lines.Text: remove the four 2.8 mm phillips screws that secure the screen to the mounting bracket using a screwdriver .
there will be two screws on either side of the mounting bracket .

Steps.Text_raw: Remove the four 2.8 mm Phillips screws that secure the screen to the mounting bracket using a screwdriver. There will be two screws on either side of the mounting bracket.

Lines.Text: you can now remove and replace the screen .

Steps.Text_raw: You can now remove and replace the screen.
